When gerbils mate, they usually have about six babies in a litter. They mate again as soon as the babies are born, so a second litter will come even if you remove the dad when the first litter arrives. The initial gestation is about 24 days. A nursing female gerbil will have a delayed gestation and usually be pregnant with the second litter for about five weeks. Male gerbils make great fathers and raising the babies is most successful when the dad is in with the mother gerbil to help out. You can get a male gerbil neutered.
